<Link id="l02234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2234"><Highlight kind="normal">        MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a3cd29e7edbcaceb5834eaa7d089a5bc4">setObjectOffset</a>(FI, LowerBound + MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#adf98860d7f42290f873c82a981eb0ea6">getObjectOffset</a>(FI));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2235"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2236"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2237"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2238"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MinReg =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2239"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::min&lt;unsigned&gt;(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinesink-cpp/#a0f36ed1bc17fc1aa97fe291c439a0698">TRI</a>-&gt;getEncodingValue(MinGPR),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2240"><Highlight kind="normal">                         <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinesink-cpp/#a0f36ed1bc17fc1aa97fe291c439a0698">TRI</a>-&gt;getEncodingValue(MinG8R));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2241"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2242"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> GPRegSize = Subtarget.isPPC64() ? 8 : 4;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2243"><Highlight kind="normal">    LowerBound -= (31 - MinReg + 1) &#42; GPRegSize;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2244"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2245"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2246"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For 32-bit only, the CR save area is below the general register</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2247"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// save area.  For 64-bit SVR4, the CR save area is addressed relative</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2248"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to the stack pointer and hence does not need an adjustment here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2249"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Only CR2 (the first nonvolatile spilled) has an associated frame</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2250"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// index so that we have a single uniform save area.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2251"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="#af515521ec01610e36ad4b3c5ece866f2">spillsCR</a>(MF) &amp;&amp; Subtarget.is32BitELFABI()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2252"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Adjust the frame index of the CR spill slot.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2253"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;CSInfo : CSI) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2254"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CSInfo.getReg() == PPC::CR2) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2256"><Highlight kind="normal">        MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a3cd29e7edbcaceb5834eaa7d089a5bc4">setObjectOffset</a>(FI, LowerBound + MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#adf98860d7f42290f873c82a981eb0ea6">getObjectOffset</a>(FI));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2257"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2258"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2259"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2260"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2261"><Highlight kind="normal">    LowerBound -= 4; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The CR save area is always 4 bytes long.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2262"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2263"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2264"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Both Altivec and SPE have the same alignment and padding requirements</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2265"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// within the stack frame.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2266"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (HasVRSaveArea) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2267"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Insert alignment padding, we need 16-byte alignment. Note: for positive</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2268"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// number the alignment formula is : y = (x + (n-1)) &amp; (~(n-1)). But since</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2269"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we are using negative number here (the stack grows downward). We should</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2270"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// use formula : y = x &amp; (~(n-1)). Where x is the size before aligning, n</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2271"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is the alignment size ( n = 16 here) and y is the size after aligning.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2272"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(LowerBound &lt;= 0 &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Expect LowerBound have a non-positive value!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2273"><Highlight kind="normal">    LowerBound &amp;= ~(15);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2767"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// registers in the array. The first pass finds the lowest numbered</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2776"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When R2/X2 is a CSR and not used for passing arguments, it is allocated</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2807"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2808" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppcframelowering/#a2cd3c8e286f88d8f80913526cf5105e6"><Highlight kind="normal">uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppcframelowering/#a2cd3c8e286f88d8f80913526cf5105e6">PPCFrameLowering::getStackThreshold</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2809"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On PPC64, we use &#96;stux r1, r1, &lt;scratch&#95;reg&gt;&#96; to extend the stack;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2810"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// use &#96;add r1, r1, &lt;scratch&#95;reg&gt;&#96; to release the stack frame.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2811"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Scratch register contains a signed 64-bit number, which is negative</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2812"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when extending the stack and is positive when releasing the stack frame.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2813"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To make &#96;stux&#96; and &#96;add&#96; paired, the absolute value of the number contained</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2814"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in the scratch register should be the same. Thus the maximum stack size</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2815"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is (2^63)-1, i.e., LONG&#95;MAX.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2816"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Subtarget.isPPC64())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2817"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LONG&#95;MAX;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2818"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
